title: Tired of League Players in Flex acting like 5 year olds
body: So tired of riot backing ppl who cant handle something typed on the screen. Your newest add campaign is a load of crap that atttracts loads of unskilled players at the end of the season. Thanks for ruining the game for me, esp in flex queue where you flame on guy and get 25 reports. I know the mute button doesnt exist in this game so everyone has to take offense to every minor insult. Oh wait there is one.

replies.body:
So you're mad because you're thin-skinned and feel the need to flame?

ok.{{champion:33}}

I mean, that doesn't make sense at all tbh, why did you call him thin skinned? Getting annoyed at other players not doing right has nothing to do with being able to take abuse. You just want to label him with something you think he would call the people he complains about to try to get a GOTCHA moment on him instead of actually make a point.

> [{quoted}](name=Emilianisawesome,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=GVnwJ380,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2017-10-22T01:38:18.411+0000)
>
> I mean, that doesn't make sense at all tbh, why did you call him thin skinned? Getting annoyed at other players not doing right has nothing to do with being able to take abuse. You just want to label him with something you think he would call the people he complains about to try to get a GOTCHA moment on him instead of actually make a point.

The point is kindness, maturity, basic human respect and integrity is lost on a fair share of the current generation. We can hope they "grow out of it" but I fear it's simply the sign of the times. Many gamers never knew a time before the internet's existence in homes. (us old timers do) That said there are simply those older, but by no means wiser setting bad examples for the younger generations. 

People are desensitized to the anonymity of online discourse and proceed to act out in ways they very likely would not do in person. 

The point that you're contending is this: People are too quick to snap at one another over a simple video game. It's entertainment. It's meant to be fun. A competitive mentality does not detract from the fact that games were created to be enjoyed. Not to insult and bully one another because someone gets set off over something. 

It would benefit the League community, as well as society as a whole if people would simply get over themselves and get along. I include every one of us including myself in that statement. We all can do better.

How is it not being thin-skinned when some small bad thing happens on a game and you feel the need to flame someone for it over the internet?

Why not just ignore it and move on realizing not everyone plays perfect every game, or that he himself doesn't play perfect either, but instead he feels the need to flame everyone about it.


How's it not making a point?

I cant believe that I have to explain to you that the actions of your teammates have ramifications in a team based pvp game. How do you ignore the actions of your teammates when they are entirely detrimental to the chances of 4 other people having an enjoyable game. You cant just ignore the actions of another player in this game, idk how you can even suggest that as an option, their actions usher in consequences that the whole team shares. Its not about playing perfect, its about playing in a way that doesnt screw over your own team. Its not making a point because being thin skinned is a saying about not being able to take abuse being thrown at you, not about someones willingness to accept the consequences of another person's actions readily.
What is worse are people like you who insult someone else. Then when they retaliate, you report them then they get punished and you roam free to do it again. :D

The mute button doesn't mean it's okay for you to flame.  There's nothing you can do to justify it.  When did it become okay to call someone a PoS or to "KyS"?  

Never. 

So stop doing it, and to you won't get reported, you won't get punished, you won't get banned, and you won't come QQ on the forums.

My reaction to people who think it's their responsibility to flame bad team mates.

https://i.imgur.com/o0FSzYU.gif

"At the end of the season"

I don't think they're level 30 yet. And if they're on equal skill with you, well...then uh...yeah.
Doesn't make you older if you get triggered and get caught into their troller-coaster magnet.
That's the funny thing, i thought everyone considered flex another normals also
